context: The word 'valida' in Estonian appears to be a verb form meaning 'to choose', 'to select', or 'to vote'. It's used in the context of rights, specifically referring to the right to choose or elect. The dictionary entry shows it used in the phrase 'aktiivne valimisõigus õigus valida' which translates to 'active voting right - the right to choose/elect'. This is likely the third-person singular form of the verb 'valida' (to choose/select).
